prompt_text:
Write a persuasive but gentle email asking a one-time donor to become a monthly
supporter of [ORGANIZATION NAME]. The letter should:

- Acknowledge their previous gift(s): [DONOR HISTORY]
- Explain why monthly giving is valuable to the organization (predictable funding, planning, sustainability)
- Show the cumulative impact of monthly giving vs. one-time (e.g., "$25/month = $300/year")
- Make it feel like joining a special community ("sustaining donors", "monthly partners")
- Address common objections without being defensive (budget flexibility, easy to pause/cancel)
- Provide specific suggested amounts: [LOW], [MEDIUM], [HIGH] per month
- Explain what each monthly amount specifically provides
- Include clear call-to-action with easy sign-up process
- Emphasize convenience (automatic, set-it-and-forget-it)
- Be 250-350 words
- Use a [WARM/ENTHUSIASTIC/FRIENDLY] tone
- Be signed by [SIGNER NAME and TITLE]

The email should make monthly giving feel like an upgrade or VIP opportunity, not
a burden. Emphasize the donor's increased impact and the organizational benefits.

scenarios.name: Small Community Org
scenarios.description: Volunteer-run urban food pantry serving 400+ families monthly in the Eastwood neighborhood; donor is a local resident who gave during community drives.

values.DONOR HISTORY: your $35 Giving Tuesday gift last December, plus the extra $20 you chipped in during our spring pantry restock

scenarios.name: Mid-Size Professional Org
scenarios.description: Regional STEM education nonprofit with mobile maker labs serving rural school districts across Kansas and Nebraska; donor is a parent who attended a hands-on showcase event.

values.DONOR HISTORY: your $75 gift after attending our Mobile Maker Lab showcase in May

scenarios.name: Large Established Org
scenarios.description: Longstanding international NGO focused on clean water infrastructure and hygiene programs in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia; donor gave during a national awareness campaign via workplace giving.

values.DONOR HISTORY: your $250 World Water Day gift in March through your company's workplace giving program
values.SIGNER NAME and TITLE: Amina Rahman, Director of Individual Giving

outputs.content:
Subject: A heartfelt thank you, and an invitation to deepen your impact at Eastwood Neighborhood Pantry!

Dear [Donor Name],

I'm writing to you today from Eastwood Neighborhood Pantry to express our sincere gratitude for your incredible generosity. We fondly remember your thoughtful $35 Giving Tuesday gift last December, and we were so touched by the extra $20 you chipped in during our spring pantry restock. Your support truly made a difference in helping us provide nutritious food to our neighbors in need.

As we continue our work, we’ve found that a consistent, predictable source of funding is invaluable. That’s why we’re inviting special supporters like you to consider becoming a monthly donor. This type of consistent support allows us to plan more effectively, sustain our programs, and respond quickly to the evolving needs of our community, ensuring our shelves are always stocked.

Imagine the impact! A monthly gift might seem small day-to-day, but it genuinely adds up. For example, a monthly gift of $25 translates to an amazing $300 over the course of a year!

Becoming a monthly partner makes you part of our "sustaining donors" community – a vital group whose ongoing commitment forms the backbone of our efforts. We understand budgets can be tight, but monthly giving is incredibly flexible. You can easily adjust, pause, or cancel your recurring donation at any time, directly through our secure portal.

Even a small amount makes a huge difference:

*   **$10 a month** helps us purchase fresh produce for 5 families.
*   **$25 a month** provides a week's worth of healthy groceries for a child.
*   **$40 a month** ensures a senior citizen receives nourishing meals for an entire month.

Ready to amplify your impact and become a cornerstone of our community? It’s incredibly easy to set up your automatic monthly gift – just click here: [Link to Monthly Donation Page]. It's a convenient, set-it-and-forget-it way to ensure your kindness consistently reaches those who need it most.

Thank you again for your generosity and for considering this special opportunity to help us build a stronger, healthier Eastwood.

Warmly,

Marisol Alvarez
Pantry Coordinator
Eastwood Neighborhood Pantry

evaluation.reasoning: This is a well-crafted email that hits most requirements with appropriate warmth and persuasiveness. It successfully frames monthly giving as a VIP opportunity while addressing objections naturally. However, it exceeds the word count significantly (380+ words vs. 250-350) and could be tightened for better impact.
strengths: Excellent personalization with specific donor history woven naturally into the opening
Strong framing of monthly giving as joining a special 'sustaining donors' community
Effective use of concrete impact examples tied to each giving level ($10, $25, $40)
Addresses objections smoothly (flexibility, pause/cancel) without being defensive
Clear call-to-action with emphasis on convenience and automation
Friendly, warm tone that feels genuine and appropriate for a small community organization
Good use of cumulative impact example ($25/month = $300/year)
weaknesses: Significantly exceeds word count limit (approximately 380 words vs. 250-350 requested)
Subject line is too long and could be more compelling/concise
The phrase 'imagine the impact!' feels slightly generic and could be more specific
Minor redundancy in gratitude expressions that could be streamlined
Missing [Donor Name] personalization tag in salutation should be noted as placeholder

outputs.content:
**Subject: Sarah, your support has made such a difference—here's how to multiply it ✨**

Dear Sarah,

Your generosity has truly stuck with me—your $35 Giving Tuesday gift last December, plus the extra $20 you chipped in during our spring pantry restock. Those contributions fed families during our busiest seasons, and I'm so grateful.

I'm writing today to invite you into something special: our Monthly Partners community. Think of it as upgrading from wonderful guest to VIP member!

Here's what excites me about monthly giving: when neighbors like you commit to automatic monthly gifts, you actually **multiply your impact** while making things easier on yourself. That $55 you've given throughout the year? As a monthly partner giving just $25/month, becomes **$300 annually**—feeding five times as many families with zero extra effort.

Even better, each monthly gift provides something specific:

- **$10/month** = fresh produce for 4 families every single month
- **$25/month** = a week's worth of staples for 2 households
- **$40/month** = protein, dairy, and grains for 3 families in need

The predictable support lets us plan smarter, stock up when prices are good, and say "yes" more often when a struggling parent walks through our doors.

I know what you might be thinking—"What if my budget changes?" No worries! You can pause or cancel anytime with one click. No phone calls, no awkward conversations. It's truly set-it-and-forget-it.

**Ready to join our Monthly Partners?** Just click here [LINK] and choose your monthly amount. The whole process takes under two minutes.

Your one-time gifts have already made a difference. Imagine the impact of showing up for our neighbors every single month.

With gratitude,

**Marisol Alvarez**  
Pantry Coordinator  
Eastwood Neighborhood Pantry

P.S. Monthly partners get first access to our impact updates—you'll see exactly how your ongoing support changes lives! 💙

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, usable email that hits nearly all requirements with appropriate tone and persuasive structure. The main weakness is a mathematical error in the impact calculation that undermines credibility. Otherwise, it effectively balances warmth with clear value proposition and addresses objections smoothly.
strengths: Excellent use of 'VIP upgrade' framing that makes monthly giving feel aspirational rather than burdensome
Specific, concrete impact statements for each giving level that are realistic for a food pantry
Smooth handling of objections (budget flexibility, easy cancellation) without being defensive
Strong personalization with donor history woven naturally into opening
Effective use of formatting (bold, bullets) for scannability
Clear, simple call-to-action with time estimate (under two minutes)
P.S. adds extra benefit (impact updates) without cluttering main message
Word count appropriate at approximately 280 words
Friendly, conversational tone that feels authentic to a community pantry coordinator
weaknesses: Mathematical error: $55 given previously does NOT become $300 as a monthly partner—$25/month equals $300, which is comparing annual totals incorrectly and could confuse or mislead donors
Subject line includes 'Sarah' but this personalization wasn't in the scenario data—assumes merge field capability without instruction
Minor: 'feeds five times as many families' calculation is unclear and potentially exaggerated based on the math error
The emoji use (✨ and 💙) may not render properly in all email clients, though it does enhance the friendly tone

outputs.content:
Subject: Join our monthly partners and make your impact go even further

Hi [First Name],

Thank you again for your generosity—your $35 Giving Tuesday gift last December, plus the extra $20 you chipped in during our spring pantry restock, helped keep our shelves full when neighbors needed it most.

I’m reaching out to invite you to join a special group of supporters: our sustaining donors. Monthly giving provides the predictable funding we rely on to plan ahead, buy in bulk (stretching every dollar), and keep our doors open steadily throughout the year.

Here’s what a monthly gift can do:
- $10/month: Keeps staples like rice, beans, and cereal on hand for one family each month.
- $25/month: $300/year—enough to provide fresh produce and proteins for several households every month.
- $40/month: Supplies a complete grocery box (20+ meals) for one household each month, plus essentials like diapers or hygiene items.

Becoming a monthly partner is an upgrade in impact, not a burden. It’s automatic, set-it-and-forget-it, and completely flexible—you can change the amount, skip a month, or pause/cancel anytime with one click or by emailing me. We’ll send simple confirmations and an annual summary for your records.

As a sustaining donor, you’ll be part of a community of neighbors who make reliable nourishment possible. We’ll share quarterly impact notes, first-to-know updates, and occasional behind-the-scenes invitations so you can see the difference you’re making.

Ready to join? It takes less than a minute:
Become a Monthly Partner: eastwoodpantry.org/monthly
Prefer help by email or phone? Just reply to this message and I’ll set everything up for you.

Thank you for considering this meaningful next step. Your steady support would help us plan with confidence and serve more families, all year long.

With gratitude,

Marisol Alvarez
Pantry Coordinator
Eastwood Neighborhood Pantry
marisol@eastwoodpantry.org | 555-123-0199

evaluation.reasoning: This is a highly effective monthly giving email that fulfills all prompt requirements with appropriate tone and strong persuasive elements. It successfully frames monthly giving as a VIP opportunity while addressing objections naturally. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic phrasing in places and the word count exceeding the target range.
strengths: Excellent acknowledgment of specific donor history that feels personalized and genuine
Strong concrete impact examples tied to each giving level with tangible outcomes (meals, grocery boxes, specific items)
Effectively addresses objections about flexibility with specific reassurance ('change amount, skip a month, pause/cancel anytime with one click')
Clear, actionable CTA with multiple options (web link and personal assistance)
Successfully positions monthly giving as 'upgrade in impact' and special community membership
Appropriate friendly tone without being overly casual or pushy
Good use of community-focused language ('neighbors,' 'sustaining donors') that fits the small local organization
Includes practical benefits like quarterly updates and behind-the-scenes access that add value
Strong subject line that emphasizes partnership and impact
weaknesses: Word count is approximately 320 words, slightly above the 250-350 range but still acceptable
Some phrases like 'make your impact go even further' and 'meaningful next step' are somewhat generic nonprofit language
The personalization placeholder [First Name] should ideally be explained or formatted differently for clarity to the user

outputs.content:
Subject: From a Spark to a Sustained Flame: Powering Prairie STEM Lab's Future!

Dear [Donor Name],

I'm writing to you today with immense gratitude and a touch of excitement! We're still buzzing from the energy of our Mobile Maker Lab showcase in May, and your generous $75 gift truly helped make it a resounding success. Thank you for believing in our mission to ignite a passion for STEM in young minds!

Your one-time gift made a wonderful impact, and I was hoping you might consider deepening your involvement by becoming a monthly supporter. Think of it as an upgrade to VIP status – becoming a vital part of our **sustaining donors** community!

Monthly giving is truly the heartbeat of Prairie STEM Lab. It provides us with predictable funding, allowing us to plan long-term projects, innovate new programs, and ensure the sustainability of our vital work. Imagine the cumulative power: a $25 monthly gift transforms into $300 a year, creating an even greater ripple effect!

We understand budgets can be tight, so we want to assure you that becoming a monthly partner is designed to be flexible. You can easily pause or adjust your donation at any time – it’s commitment-free, just continuous impact!

Here’s how even a small monthly gift can make a huge difference:

*   **$15 a month** provides materials for one student to engage in a full workshop series.
*   **$30 a month** sponsors a Mobile Maker Lab visit to a rural school.
*   **$60 a month** helps us develop new, cutting-edge STEM curriculum.

Becoming a monthly donor is incredibly convenient – it's an automatic, "set-it-and-forget-it" way to consistently invest in the future. Just visit [Link to Monthly Giving Page] to join our special community of monthly partners. It only takes a couple of minutes!

Your previous support showed us that you share our vision. By becoming a monthly donor, you’re not just giving; you’re becoming an indispensable architect of innovation, directly fueling curiosity and discovery in countless young lives.

Thank you again for your incredible generosity. We’d be honored to welcome you to our family of monthly supporters!

Warmly,

Dr. Kevin Liu
Executive Director
Prairie STEM Lab

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, well-structured email that hits nearly all requirements with appropriate enthusiasm. The tone is warm and engaging without being pushy. However, there are minor issues with word count (exceeds 350), and some phrasing feels slightly over-enthusiastic ('indispensable architect of innovation') which may reduce authenticity for some audiences.
strengths: Excellent acknowledgment of previous gift with specific context (May showcase event)
Strong VIP/community framing with 'sustaining donors' and 'monthly partners' language
Clear, specific impact statements for each giving level that directly relate to the organization's mission
Effectively addresses objections about flexibility and cancellation without being defensive
Strong subject line that's creative and mission-aligned
Clear call-to-action with mention of ease and convenience
Good use of formatting (bold, bullets) to enhance readability
Enthusiastic tone is well-executed and appropriate for the scenario
weaknesses: Word count is approximately 380-390 words, exceeding the 250-350 word requirement by about 10-15%
Some metaphorical language may be overly flowery ('architect of innovation,' 'spark to sustained flame') and could feel inauthentic to some readers
The cumulative impact example uses $25/month instead of one of the specified amounts ($15, $30, $60), creating minor inconsistency
Missing placeholder for actual link URL (shows '[Link to Monthly Giving Page]' which is fine for a template but could be more specific)
The phrase 'commitment-free, just continuous impact' is slightly contradictory and could be reworded for clarity

outputs.content:
**Subject: Kevin, your support sparked something special—let's keep the momentum going!**

Dear Kevin,

I'm still thinking about the excitement in the room during our Mobile Maker Lab showcase in May—and your generous $75 gift that followed! Your support helped us bring hands-on STEM experiences to even more young innovators this summer.

I'm reaching out with an exciting opportunity to amplify your impact: **join our Sustaining Partners community** by becoming a monthly donor.

Here's why this is such a game-changer for Prairie STEM Lab: monthly giving provides the predictable, reliable funding that allows us to plan confidently, invest in quality materials, and reach more students year-round. Instead of wondering "will we have the resources?", we can focus entirely on inspiring the next generation of problem-solvers.

**Your monthly gift grows exponentially:**
- **$15/month** ($180/year) provides materials for 6 students to complete a robotics project
- **$30/month** ($360/year) sponsors one student's full semester in our Maker Lab program
- **$60/month** ($720/year) brings our Mobile Maker Lab to an underserved community twice

The best part? **It's completely flexible.** Set it up once, and your support happens automatically—no reminders needed! You can adjust or pause anytime, though we hope you won't want to.

As a Sustaining Partner, you'll receive exclusive updates showing exactly how your ongoing support creates lasting change in our community.

**Ready to upgrade your impact?** Visit **prairiestemlab.org/monthly** or reply to this email, and I'll personally help you get started. It takes just two minutes!

Thank you for believing in what we're building together.

With gratitude and excitement,

**Dr. Kevin Liu**  
Executive Director, Prairie STEM Lab

P.S. Joining this month means your first gift helps us prepare for our fall programming—perfect timing!

evaluation.reasoning: The email has strong tone and structure but contains a critical error: it addresses the donor as 'Kevin' when Kevin Liu is the signer, not the recipient. This personalization mistake would be immediately noticed and undermines the entire piece. The content itself is well-crafted and enthusiastic, but this error makes it unusable without correction.
strengths: Excellent enthusiastic tone that feels warm and energizing without being pushy
Strong use of 'Sustaining Partners' branding to create community feeling
Specific, tangible impact examples for each giving level that connect to the organization's mission
Good structure with clear CTA and multiple pathways to give (website and email reply)
Effective P.S. that adds urgency without pressure
Successfully addresses flexibility/cancellation concerns naturally
Stays within word count (approximately 290 words)
Subject line is engaging and personal
weaknesses: CRITICAL ERROR: Addresses donor as 'Kevin' when that's the signer's name—this is a major personalization failure that makes the email unusable as-is
Subject line uses 'Kevin' which appears to be meant for personalization but conflicts with signer name
Doesn't explicitly mention 'set-it-and-forget-it' language as requested, though convenience is implied
Could be more explicit about the ease of sign-up process details
The cumulative impact comparison (monthly vs. one-time) could be slightly more prominent

outputs.content:
Subject: Turn your May spark into year-round impact

Hi [First Name],

Thank you again for your $75 gift after attending our Mobile Maker Lab showcase in May. You helped put real tools and tech in students’ hands—3D printers humming, circuits blinking, and curiosity ignited.

I’d love to invite you to join our community of Monthly Partners—our sustaining donors who keep Prairie STEM Lab moving all year. Monthly giving provides predictable funding, so we can plan our school-year calendar with confidence, keep the Lab stocked, and grow programs sustainably between big fundraising moments.

It’s amazing how it adds up: $25/month = $300/year. Set it once, and your impact keeps working in the background—automatic, secure, set-it-and-forget-it.

Choose a level that fits your budget:
- $15/month ($180/year): restocks filament, LEDs, and batteries for one Mobile Maker Lab visit—supplying a class with hands-on materials.
- $30/month ($360/year): fuels a rural school stop and equips 20 students with maker kits.
- $60/month ($720/year): sponsors a full classroom workshop, including take-home kits and teacher support.

We know budgets change. You can update, pause, or cancel anytime—no questions asked. Start small, or step up when it’s right for you. As a Monthly Partner, you’ll join our Sustaining Donors Circle with insider updates, impact stories, and first invitations to new lab showcases—a VIP way to expand the spark you began in May. You’ll also receive a simple monthly receipt and an annual summary for easy tax prep.

Become a Monthly Partner in about 60 seconds at prairiestemlab.org/monthly. Your steady support helps us plan with certainty and bring STEM wonder to more kids, month after month.

With gratitude,

Dr. Kevin Liu
Executive Director
Prairie STEM Lab

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, usable email that hits nearly all requirements with an appropriately enthusiastic tone. The vivid STEM imagery and concrete impact examples are compelling. Minor issues include exceeding word count (380+ vs 250-350) and some redundancy in benefits messaging.
strengths: Excellent enthusiastic tone with vivid, sensory language ('3D printers humming, circuits blinking') that connects to the organization's mission authentically
Strong concrete impact examples tied to specific monthly amounts, making the ask tangible and mission-focused
Effectively addresses objections (budget flexibility, pause/cancel) without being defensive
Good use of VIP/community framing with 'Monthly Partners' and 'Sustaining Donors Circle' with specific benefits
Clear call-to-action with URL and time estimate ('60 seconds') reduces friction
Smart subject line that references the donor's previous engagement
weaknesses: Exceeds word count requirement significantly (approximately 380 words vs. 250-350 requested)
Contains a math error: states '$25/month = $300/year' in paragraph 3, but doesn't offer $25 as a giving level (offers $15, $30, $60 instead)
Some redundancy between 'set-it-and-forget-it' convenience messaging and later benefits description
The Sustaining Donors Circle benefits could be slightly more specific or exclusive-feeling to strengthen VIP positioning

outputs.content:
Subject: A World of Difference, Sustained: Your Impact with Global Clean Water Initiative

Dear [Donor Name],

We're still so grateful for your generous $250 gift during World Water Day in March, made through your company's workplace giving program. Your support helps us bring life-saving clean water to communities in need, and we truly appreciate your commitment to this vital cause!

I'm writing today with a special invitation to deepen your impact and become a cornerstone of our mission by joining our community of **sustaining donors**. Imagine the consistent difference you could make as a monthly partner – this predictable funding is truly invaluable. It allows us to plan long-term projects, respond swiftly to emergencies, and ensure uninterrupted access to clean water for thousands.

While one-time gifts are wonderful, monthly support creates a ripple effect. For instance, a gift of just $25 a month—which is less than a dollar a day—adds up to $300 over a year, far exceeding the initial $250. This stability allows us to implement groundbreaking solutions with confidence.

We understand that budgets can be tight, which is why we've designed our monthly giving program for ultimate flexibility. You can easily pause, adjust, or cancel your donation at any time – you're always in control.

Consider becoming a monthly partner at one of these levels, and see the tangible impact you'll have:

*   **$25/month** provides 50 people with clean drinking water for a year.
*   **$50/month** funds hygiene education for an entire village.
*   **$100/month** helps install a new community water point, providing access to a thriving village.

Becoming a monthly supporter is simple, convenient, and truly makes a lasting difference. It’s an automatic, set-it-and-forget-it way to ensure your compassion flows directly to those who need it most, month after month.

Ready to elevate your impact? Join our special community of monthly partners today by visiting our secure sign-up page: [Link to Monthly Giving Page]

Thank you for considering this upgrade to your incredible support. Together, we can build a world where clean water is a reality for everyone.

Warmly,

Amina Rahman
Director of Individual Giving
Global Clean Water Initiative

evaluation.reasoning: This is a well-crafted email that hits most requirements effectively. The tone is appropriately warm and inviting, and it successfully frames monthly giving as an upgrade opportunity. However, it exceeds the word count significantly (370+ words vs. 250-350), and some impact claims need verification for accuracy.
strengths: Excellent use of community language ('sustaining donors,' 'monthly partners,' 'cornerstone of our mission') that creates VIP feeling
Strong acknowledgment of previous gift with specific details from donor history
Effective handling of objections with reassuring language about flexibility and control
Clear mathematical comparison showing cumulative impact ($25/month = $300/year vs. original $250)
Specific impact statements for each giving level that are concrete and tangible
Good metaphorical language ('ripple effect,' 'compassion flows') that fits the water mission
Strong call-to-action with clear next steps
Appropriate warm tone throughout with personal touches
weaknesses: Exceeds word count limit (approximately 370 words vs. requested 250-350)
Impact claims may need verification - '50 people with clean drinking water for a year' for $25/month seems potentially inflated and could damage credibility if inaccurate
Subject line is somewhat long and abstract; could be more direct and action-oriented
Missing personalization token in greeting (shows [Donor Name] rather than explaining this should be personalized)
The phrase 'set-it-and-forget-it' while emphasizing convenience, could unintentionally suggest the donor should forget about the organization

outputs.content:
**Subject: Sarah, your March gift is still making waves 💧**

Dear Sarah,

Your $250 World Water Day gift in March brought clean water to 12 families in northern Ghana. I still think about the photo we received of little Akosua drinking from her village's new well for the first time—that's the change you created.

I'm writing today with an invitation to deepen that impact in a way that might actually be easier than you think.

**What if your generosity could flow as reliably as the water you help provide?**

Our Monthly Partners Circle is a community of supporters who've discovered something powerful: spreading their giving throughout the year actually multiplies their impact. Here's how:

- **$25/month** ($300/year) maintains a water point for an entire year, ensuring families like Akosua's have clean water every single day
- **$50/month** ($600/year) trains two local water technicians who'll serve their communities for decades
- **$100/month** ($900/year) provides complete water and hygiene education for an entire school

Beyond the cumulative impact, your monthly support gives us something invaluable: the ability to plan. When we know funds are coming, we can commit to multi-year projects and hire local staff with confidence.

The best part? It's completely automatic—easier than remembering to give annually. And life changes, we know—you can adjust or pause anytime with one email.

**Will you join 847 Monthly Partners** who've chosen to make clean water their cause?

Simply visit **cleanwater.org/monthly** or reply to this email with your preferred amount. Your first gift processes next month, and you'll receive exclusive quarterly impact updates from the field.

Thank you for considering this upgrade to your generosity, Sarah.

With gratitude,

**Amina Rahman**  
Director of Individual Giving  
Global Clean Water Initiative

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professionally crafted email that hits most requirements effectively. The tone is appropriately warm without being overly familiar, and the specific impact examples are compelling. Minor issues include using a donor name not provided in the scenario and a small math error in the $100/month calculation.
strengths: Excellent opening hook with specific, emotional impact story (Akosua and the well) that personalizes the previous gift
Strong value proposition framing monthly giving as an 'upgrade' and 'invitation' rather than a request, creating VIP feeling
Clear, specific impact statements for each giving level that are concrete and meaningful (maintains water point, trains technicians, school education)
Effectively addresses objections with reassuring language about flexibility ('adjust or pause anytime with one email')
Good use of social proof ('847 Monthly Partners') to create community feeling
Compelling organizational benefit explanation (planning, multi-year projects, local staff)
Strong call-to-action with multiple options (website link and email reply) and clear next steps
Appropriate length at approximately 280 words, within the 250-350 range
Effective subject line that's personal and uses relevant emoji appropriately
weaknesses: Uses donor name 'Sarah' which was not provided in the scenario data—personalizes without authorization
Math error: $100/month equals $1,200/year, not $900/year as stated
Could more explicitly emphasize the 'set-it-and-forget-it' convenience aspect requested in the prompt
The 'Monthly Partners Circle' name is introduced but could be reinforced more strongly as a special community designation

outputs.content:
Subject: Your next-level impact with Global Clean Water Initiative

Dear [First Name],

Thank you again for your $250 World Water Day gift in March through your company’s workplace giving program. Your generosity helped families access safe, reliable water when they needed it most.

I’m writing to invite you to take the next step as a Monthly Partner—our community of sustaining donors who make clean water possible all year long. Monthly giving provides the predictable funding that lets our teams plan ahead, purchase supplies wisely, and keep systems running sustainably long after the ribbon-cutting.

It’s also an easy, set-it-and-forget-it way to grow your impact over time:
- $25/month = $300/year: can provide replacement filters for families and quarterly water-quality testing in a village.
- $50/month = $600/year: helps train and equip a local water committee and supplies the spare parts that keep a community well flowing.
- $100/month = $1,200/year: can fund a school’s clean water system and hygiene education for hundreds of students.

As a Monthly Partner, you’ll receive insider updates from the field and invitations to briefings with our program leaders—because you’re powering the backbone of this work.

We know budgets change. You can choose your amount and charge date, and you can pause, change, or cancel anytime with a click. Receipts are automatic and emailed for your records.

Ready to make your impact go even further? Join in under two minutes at: globalcleanwater.org/monthly. Select your amount, set your preferences, and we’ll take care of the rest.

Thank you for being a champion for clean water. We’d be honored to welcome you into our sustaining community.

With gratitude,

Amina Rahman
Director of Individual Giving
Global Clean Water Initiative
giving@globalcleanwater.org | 555-012-3478

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professionally crafted fundraising email that hits all major requirements. It successfully balances persuasion with gentleness, uses concrete impact examples, and addresses objections naturally. The tone is warm without being overly familiar, and the structure flows logically from acknowledgment to invitation to action.
strengths: Excellent concrete impact examples tied to each giving level (filters/testing, water committees, school systems) that are specific and believable for the organization type
Natural integration of objection-handling ('budgets change,' pause/cancel flexibility) without sounding defensive
Strong community-building language ('Monthly Partner,' 'sustaining community,' 'insider updates') that creates VIP feel as requested
Clear, actionable CTA with URL and specific next steps ('under two minutes,' 'select your amount')
Perfect word count at approximately 280 words, well within the 250-350 range
Effective subject line that hints at upgrade opportunity without being pushy
Good use of formatting (bullets, bold) to make key information scannable
Appropriate warm tone that matches the request and organizational context
weaknesses: The phrase 'when they needed it most' in the opening is slightly generic and could be more specific to World Water Day context
Could have slightly stronger personalization beyond [First Name] merge tag—perhaps referencing workplace giving culture or corporate partnership
Minor: The contact information at bottom (phone/email) wasn't explicitly requested in the template, though it's good practice
